testcase.name: Adding a new user
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Adding a new user # src/feature/ UserManagement.feature:6 Given I am logged in as an admin # fit.UserManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdmin() When I add a new user "omar" with email "omar@gmail.com" and role "Instructor" # fit.UserManagementSteps.iAddANewUser(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Then the user "omar" should be added successfully # fit.UserManagementSteps.theUserShouldBeAddedSuccessfully(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Updating a user's role
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Updating a user's role # src/feature/ UserManagement.feature:11 Given I am logged in as an admin # fit.UserManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdmin() When I update the role of user "rasmiya@gmail.com" to "Client" # fit.UserManagementSteps.iUpdateTheRoleOfUser(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Then the user's role should be updated to "Client" # fit.UserManagementSteps.theUsersRoleShouldBeUpdatedTo(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Disabling a user's account
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Disabling a user's account # src/feature/ UserManagement.feature:16 Given I am logged in as an admin # fit.UserManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdmin() When I disable the account of user "hiba@gmail.com" # fit.UserManagementSteps.iDisableTheAccountOfUser(java.lang.String) Then the account of "Hiba" should be disabled # fit.UserManagementSteps.theAccountOfShouldBeDisabled(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Approving a new instructor registration
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Approving a new instructor registration # src/feature/ UserManagement.feature:21 Given I am logged in as an admin # fit.UserManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdmin() When I approve the registration for "rasmiya@gmail.com" # fit.UserManagementSteps.iApproveTheRegistrationFor(java.lang.String) Then "Rasmiya" should be approved as an instructor # fit.UserManagementSteps.shouldBeApprovedAsAnInstructor(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Client updates personal details
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Client updates personal details # src/feature/AccountManagement.feature:4 Logged in as client: Hiba Given I am logged in as a general client "Hiba" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAGeneralClient(java.lang.String) Access denied. Please log in to manage your account. Navigated to the Account Management page. When I navigate to the "Account Management" page # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iNavigateToThePage(java.lang.String) Username: Hiba And I update my personal details with age "25" and fitness goals "Weight loss" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iUpdateMyPersonalDetailsWithAgeAndFitnessGoals(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Expected Message: Personal details updated successfully Actual Result: Personal details updated successfully Then I should see the account management message "Personal details updated successfully" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iShouldSeeTheAccountManagementMessage(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Client updates dietary preferences
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Client updates dietary preferences # src/feature/AccountManagement.feature:10 Logged in as client: Hiba Given I am logged in as a general client "Hiba" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAGeneralClient(java.lang.String) Access denied. Please log in to manage your account. Navigated to the Account Management page. When I navigate to the "Account Management" page # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iNavigateToThePage(java.lang.String) Updating dietary preferences for user: Hiba And I update my dietary preferences to "Vegetarian" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iUpdateMyDietaryPreferences(java.lang.String) Expected Message: Dietary preferences updated successfully Actual Result: Dietary preferences updated successfully Then I should see the account management message "Dietary preferences updated successfully" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iShouldSeeTheAccountManagementMessage(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Admin updates user details
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Admin updates user details # src/feature/AccountManagement.feature:16 Given I am logged in as an admin "Wafaa" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdmin(java.lang.String) Access denied. Please log in to manage your account. Navigated to the User Management page. When I navigate to the "User Management" page # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iNavigateToThePage(java.lang.String) And I select the user "Hiba" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iSelectTheUser(java.lang.String) And I update the user's email to "hiba_updated@gmail.com" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iUpdateTheUserSEmailTo(java.lang.String) Then I should see as admin "User details updated successfully" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iShouldSeeAsAdmin(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Client tries to update account without logging in
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Client tries to update account without logging in # src/feature/AccountManagement.feature:23 User is not logged in. Given I am not logged in # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iAmNotLoggedIn() Access denied. Please log in to manage your account. Navigated to the Account Management page. When I navigate to the "Account Management" page # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iNavigateToThePage(java.lang.String) Expected Message: Access denied. Please log in to manage your account. Actual Result: Access denied. Please log in to manage your account. Then I should see the account management message "Access denied. Please log in to manage your account." # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iShouldSeeTheAccountManagementMessage(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Client updates password
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Client updates password # src/feature/AccountManagement.feature:28 Logged in as client: Sara Given I am logged in as a general client "Sara" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAGeneralClient(java.lang.String) Access denied. Please log in to manage your account. Navigated to the Account Management page. When I navigate to the "Account Management" page # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iNavigateToThePage(java.lang.String) Attempting to update password for user: Sara Password update result: Password updated successfully And I update my password from "H1515" to "sara@2024" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iUpdateMyPasswordFromTo(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Expected Message: Password updated successfully Actual Result: Password updated successfully Then I should see the account management message "Password updated successfully" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iShouldSeeTheAccountManagementMessage(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Admin deletes a user account
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Admin deletes a user account # src/feature/AccountManagement.feature:34 Given I am logged in as an admin "Wafaa" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdmin(java.lang.String) Access denied. Please log in to manage your account. Navigated to the User Management page. When I navigate to the "User Management" page # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iNavigateToThePage(java.lang.String) And I select the user "Hiba" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iSelectTheUser(java.lang.String) Attempting to delete user: Hiba Delete result: User account deleted successfully And I click the delete button AM # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iClickTheDeleteButton() Then I should see as admin "User account deleted successfully" # fit.AccountManagementSteps.iShouldSeeAsAdmin(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Client receives notification about a new program
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Client receives notification about a new program # src/feature/Notifications.feature:4 Logged in as client: Hiba Given I am logged in as a client "Hiba" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAClient(java.lang.String) New program added and notification sent: Yoga for Beginners When a new program "Yoga for Beginners" is added # fit.NotificationsandUpdatesSteps.aNewProgramIsAdded(java.lang.String) Expected: New program available: Yoga for Beginners Actual: [New program available: Yoga for Beginners, Program updated: Yoga for Beginners, Program canceled: Yoga for Beginners] Then I should receive a notification "New program available: Yoga for Beginners" # fit.NotificationsandUpdatesSteps.iShouldReceiveANotification(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Instructor receives notification about client enrollment
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Instructor receives notification about client enrollment # src/feature/Notifications.feature:9 Given I am logged in as an instructor "Rasmiya" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_am_logged_in_as_an_instructor(java.lang.String) Enrollment notification sent: Client Hiba enrolled in Yoga for Beginners When a client "Hiba" enrolls in the program "Yoga for Beginners" # fit.NotificationsandUpdatesSteps.aClientEnrollsInTheProgram(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Expected: Client Hiba enrolled in Yoga for Beginners Actual: [Client Hiba enrolled in Yoga for Beginners, New message from Hiba: I have a question about my schedule.] Then I should receive a notification "Client Hiba enrolled in Yoga for Beginners" # fit.NotificationsandUpdatesSteps.iShouldReceiveANotification(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Client receives notification about program updates
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Client receives notification about program updates # src/feature/Notifications.feature:14 Logged in as client: Hiba Given I am logged in as a client "Hiba" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAClient(java.lang.String) Program updated notification sent: Yoga for Beginners When the program "Yoga for Beginners" is updated # fit.NotificationsandUpdatesSteps.theProgramIsUpdated(java.lang.String) Expected: Program updated: Yoga for Beginners Actual: [New program available: Yoga for Beginners, Program updated: Yoga for Beginners, Program canceled: Yoga for Beginners] Then I should receive a notification "Program updated: Yoga for Beginners" # fit.NotificationsandUpdatesSteps.iShouldReceiveANotification(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Instructor receives notification about a client message
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Instructor receives notification about a client message # src/feature/Notifications.feature:19 Given I am logged in as an instructor "Rasmiya" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_am_logged_in_as_an_instructor(java.lang.String) Message notification sent: New message from Hiba: I have a question about my schedule. When the client "Hiba" sends a message "I have a question about my schedule." # fit.NotificationsandUpdatesSteps.theClientSendsAMessage(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Expected: New message from Hiba: I have a question about my schedule. Actual: [Client Hiba enrolled in Yoga for Beginners, New message from Hiba: I have a question about my schedule.] Then I should receive a notification "New message from Hiba: I have a question about my schedule." # fit.NotificationsandUpdatesSteps.iShouldReceiveANotification(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Client receives notification about program cancellation
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Client receives notification about program cancellation # src/feature/Notifications.feature:24 Logged in as client: Hiba Given I am logged in as a client "Hiba" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAClient(java.lang.String) Cancellation notification sent: Yoga for Beginners When the program "Yoga for Beginners" is canceled # fit.NotificationsandUpdatesSteps.theProgramIsCanceled(java.lang.String) Expected: Program canceled: Yoga for Beginners Actual: [New program available: Yoga for Beginners, Program updated: Yoga for Beginners, Program canceled: Yoga for Beginners] Then I should receive a notification "Program canceled: Yoga for Beginners" # fit.NotificationsandUpdatesSteps.iShouldReceiveANotification(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Create a new fitness program successfully
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Create a new fitness program successfully # src/feature/ProgramManagement.feature:4 Given I am logged in as an instructor "Rasmiya" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_am_logged_in_as_an_instructor(java.lang.String) Access denied. Please log in to manage your account. Navigated to the Create Program page. And I navigate to the "Create Program" page # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iNavigateToThePage(java.lang.String) When I enter a valid program title "Yoga for Beginners" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_enter_a_valid_program_title(java.lang.String) And I enter a duration of "4 weeks" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_enter_a_duration_of(java.lang.String) And I define the goals as "Improve flexibility and reduce stress" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_define_the_goals_as(java.lang.String) And I set the price to "$50" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_set_the_price_to(java.lang.String) And I save the program # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_save_the_program() Then I should see a message "Program created successfully" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_should_see_a_message(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Edit an existing fitness program
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Edit an existing fitness program # src/feature/ProgramManagement.feature:14 Given I am logged in as an instructor "Rasmiya" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_am_logged_in_as_an_instructor(java.lang.String) Access denied. Please log in to manage your account. Navigated to the Manage Programs page. And I navigate to the "Manage Programs" page # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iNavigateToThePage(java.lang.String) Program selected: Yoga for Beginners,4 weeks,Improve flexibility and reduce stress,$50 And I select the program "Yoga for Beginners" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iSelectTheProgram(java.lang.String) When I update the duration to "6 weeks" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_update_the_duration_to(java.lang.String) And I change the price to "$75" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_change_the_price_to(java.lang.String) Changes saved successfully. And I save the changes # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iSaveTheChanges() Then I should see a message "Program updated successfully" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_should_see_a_message(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Delete an existing fitness program
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Delete an existing fitness program # src/feature/ProgramManagement.feature:23 Given I am logged in as an instructor "Rasmiya" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_am_logged_in_as_an_instructor(java.lang.String) Access denied. Please log in to manage your account. Navigated to the Manage Programs page. And I navigate to the "Manage Programs" page # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iNavigateToThePage(java.lang.String) Program selected: Yoga for Beginners,4 weeks,Improve flexibility and reduce stress,$50 And I select the program "Yoga for Beginners" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iSelectTheProgram(java.lang.String) When I click the delete button # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_click_the_delete_button() Program deleted successfully: Yoga for Beginners And I confirm the deletion # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iConfirmTheDeletion() Then I should see a message "Program deleted successfully" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_should_see_a_message(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Attempt to create a program without a title
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Attempt to create a program without a title # src/feature/ProgramManagement.feature:31 Given I am logged in as an instructor "Rasmiya" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_am_logged_in_as_an_instructor(java.lang.String) Access denied. Please log in to manage your account. Navigated to the Create Program page. And I navigate to the "Create Program" page # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iNavigateToThePage(java.lang.String) Program title field left empty. When I leave the program title field empty # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iLeaveTheProgramTitleFieldEmpty() Attempt to save a program without a title. And I try to save the program # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iTryToSaveTheProgram() Then I should see an error message "Program title is required" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iShouldSeeAnErrorMessage(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Non-instructor trying to manage programs
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Non-instructor trying to manage programs # src/feature/ProgramManagement.feature:38 Logged in as client: Hiba Given I am logged in as a client "Hiba" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAClient(java.lang.String) When I try to navigate to the "Manage Programs" page # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_try_to_navigate_to_the_page(java.lang.String) Then I should see a message "Access denied. Only instructors can manage programs" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_should_see_a_message(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: View popular programs by enrollment
testcase.system-out: Scenario: View popular programs by enrollment # src/feature/ProgramMonitoring.feature:6 Given I am logged in as an admin for program monitoring # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdminForProgramMonitoring() When I access the program statistics section # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iAccessTheProgramStatisticsSection() Then I should see a list of programs sorted by their popularity based on enrollment # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iShouldSeeAListOfProgramsSortedByTheirPopularityBasedOnEnrollment()

testcase.name: Generate revenue reports
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Generate revenue reports # src/feature/ProgramMonitoring.feature:11 Given I am logged in as an admin for program monitoring # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdminForProgramMonitoring() When I select to generate a revenue report # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iSelectToGenerateARevenueReport() Then I should receive a detailed report on revenue sorted by program # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iShouldReceiveADetailedReportOnRevenueSortedByProgram()

testcase.name: Monitor attendance in programs
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Monitor attendance in programs # src/feature/ProgramMonitoring.feature:16 Given I am logged in as an admin for program monitoring # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdminForProgramMonitoring() When I access the attendance tracking section # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iAccessTheAttendanceTrackingSection() Then I should see attendance statistics for each program # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iShouldSeeAttendanceStatisticsForEachProgram()

testcase.name: Generate client progress reports
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Generate client progress reports # src/feature/ProgramMonitoring.feature:21 Given I am logged in as an admin for program monitoring # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdminForProgramMonitoring() When I choose to generate a progress report for clients # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iChooseToGenerateAProgressReportForClients() Then I should receive a report detailing client progress in various programs # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iShouldReceiveAReportDetailingClientProgressInVariousPrograms()

testcase.name: Track active and completed programs
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Track active and completed programs # src/feature/ProgramMonitoring.feature:26 Given I am logged in as an admin for program monitoring # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdminForProgramMonitoring() When I look at the current program roster # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iLookAtTheCurrentProgramRoster() Then I should see lists differentiating active from completed programs # fit.ProgramMonitoringsteps.iShouldSeeListsDifferentiatingActiveFromCompletedPrograms()

testcase.name: Successful sign-up
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Successful sign-up # src/feature/Signup.feature:4 Navigating to the sign-up page. Given I am on the sign-up page # fit.Signupsteps.iAmOnTheSignUpPage() When I enter a valid username "Khaled123" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidUsername(java.lang.String) And I enter a valid email "khaled123@gmail.com" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidEmail(java.lang.String) And I enter a valid role "Admin" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidRole(java.lang.String) And I enter a valid password "Khaled234" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidPassword(java.lang.String) And I confirm the password "Khaled234" # fit.Signupsteps.iConfirmThePassword(java.lang.String) And I click the sign-up button # fit.Signupsteps.iClickTheSignUpButton() Then I should see "Account created successfully" # fit.Signupsteps.iShouldSee(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Sign-up with invalid email
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Sign-up with invalid email # src/feature/Signup.feature:14 Navigating to the sign-up page. Given I am on the sign-up page # fit.Signupsteps.iAmOnTheSignUpPage() When I enter a valid username "Ahmed2023" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidUsername(java.lang.String) And I enter an invalid email "ahmedemail.com" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAnInvalidEmail(java.lang.String) And I enter a valid role "Admin" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidRole(java.lang.String) And I enter a valid password "Ahmed@1234" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidPassword(java.lang.String) And I confirm the password "Ahmed@1234" # fit.Signupsteps.iConfirmThePassword(java.lang.String) And I click the sign-up button # fit.Signupsteps.iClickTheSignUpButton() Then I should see "Email must end with @gmail.com" # fit.Signupsteps.iShouldSee(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Sign-up with invalid password
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Sign-up with invalid password # src/feature/Signup.feature:24 Navigating to the sign-up page. Given I am on the sign-up page # fit.Signupsteps.iAmOnTheSignUpPage() When I enter a valid username "Mohammed123" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidUsername(java.lang.String) And I enter a valid email "mohammed123@gmail.com" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidEmail(java.lang.String) And I enter a valid role "Instructor" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidRole(java.lang.String) And I enter an invalid password "12345" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAnInvalidPassword(java.lang.String) And I confirm the password "12345" # fit.Signupsteps.iConfirmThePassword(java.lang.String) And I click the sign-up button # fit.Signupsteps.iClickTheSignUpButton() Then I should see "Password must be at least 6 characters long and contain at least one letter" # fit.Signupsteps.iShouldSee(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Passwords do not match
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Passwords do not match # src/feature/Signup.feature:34 Navigating to the sign-up page. Given I am on the sign-up page # fit.Signupsteps.iAmOnTheSignUpPage() When I enter a valid username "Sarah" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidUsername(java.lang.String) And I enter a valid email "sarah@gmail.com" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidEmail(java.lang.String) And I enter a valid role "Client" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidRole(java.lang.String) And I enter a valid password "Sarah@123" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidPassword(java.lang.String) And I confirm the password "Sarah@124" # fit.Signupsteps.iConfirmThePassword(java.lang.String) And I click the sign-up button # fit.Signupsteps.iClickTheSignUpButton() Then I should see "Passwords do not match. Please make sure to confirm correctly" # fit.Signupsteps.iShouldSee(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Sign-up with invalid role
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Sign-up with invalid role # src/feature/Signup.feature:44 Navigating to the sign-up page. Given I am on the sign-up page # fit.Signupsteps.iAmOnTheSignUpPage() When I enter a valid username "JohnDoe" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidUsername(java.lang.String) And I enter a valid email "johndoe@gmail.com" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidEmail(java.lang.String) And I enter an invalid role "Chef" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAnInvalidRole(java.lang.String) And I enter a valid password "JohnDoe@123" # fit.Signupsteps.iEnterAValidPassword(java.lang.String) And I confirm the password "JohnDoe@123" # fit.Signupsteps.iConfirmThePassword(java.lang.String) And I click the sign-up button # fit.Signupsteps.iClickTheSignUpButton() Then I should see "Invalid role. Available roles are: Admin, Instructor, Client, Store Owner" # fit.Signupsteps.iShouldSee(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Adding a subscription plan
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Adding a subscription plan # src/feature/SubscriptionManagement.feature:6 Given I am logged in as an admin # fit.UserManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdmin() When I add a new plan "Elite" with price 200 # fit.SubscriptionManagement.iAddANewPlanWithPrice(java.lang.String,int) Then the plan should be added # fit.SubscriptionManagement.the_plan_should_be_added()

testcase.name: Deleting a subscription plan
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Deleting a subscription plan # src/feature/SubscriptionManagement.feature:11 Given I am logged in as an admin # fit.UserManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdmin() And the plan "Basic" exists # fit.SubscriptionManagement.thePlanExists(java.lang.String) When I delete the plan "Basic" # fit.SubscriptionManagement.iDeleteThePlan(java.lang.String) Then it should be removed # fit.SubscriptionManagement.itShouldBeRemoved()

testcase.name: Rejecting a subscription upgrade request
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Rejecting a subscription upgrade request # src/feature/SubscriptionManagement.feature:17 Given I am logged in as an admin # fit.UserManagementSteps.iAmLoggedInAsAnAdmin() And a client has requested an upgrade with email "client@gmail.com" # fit.SubscriptionManagement.aClientHasRequestedAnUpgrade(java.lang.String) When I reject the upgrade for client with email "client@gmail.com" # fit.SubscriptionManagement.iRejectTheUpgrade(java.lang.String) Then the client's subscription should stay the same # fit.SubscriptionManagement.theClientSSubscriptionShouldStayTheSame() Client has been notified about the rejection. And the client should be notified # fit.SubscriptionManagement.theClientShouldBeNotified()

testcase.name: Sending a message to a client
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Sending a message to a client # src/feature/clientInteraction.feature:4 Given I am logged in as an instructor "Rasmiya" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_am_logged_in_as_an_instructor(java.lang.String) Selected client: Hiba And I select the client "Hiba" # fit.ClientInteractionSteps.iSelectTheClient(java.lang.String) When I send a message "Great progress this week! Keep it up!" # fit.ClientInteractionSteps.iSendAMessage(java.lang.String) Then the client "Hiba" should receive the message "Great progress this week! Keep it up!" # fit.ClientInteractionSteps.theClientShouldReceiveTheMessage(java.lang.String,java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Providing feedback to a client
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Providing feedback to a client # src/feature/clientInteraction.feature:16 Given I am logged in as an instructor "Rasmiya" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_am_logged_in_as_an_instructor(java.lang.String) Selected client: Hiba And I select the client "Hiba" # fit.ClientInteractionSteps.iSelectTheClient(java.lang.String) When I provide feedback "You need to focus more on consistency in your training." # fit.ClientInteractionSteps.iProvideFeedback(java.lang.String) Then the client "Hiba" should receive the feedback "You need to focus more on consistency in your training." # fit.ClientInteractionSteps.theClientShouldReceiveTheFeedback(java.lang.String,java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Viewing client progress
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Viewing client progress # src/feature/clientInteraction.feature:22 Given I am logged in as an instructor "Rasmiya" # fit.ProgramManagementSteps.i_am_logged_in_as_an_instructor(java.lang.String) Selected client: Hiba And I select the client "Hiba" # fit.ClientInteractionSteps.iSelectTheClient(java.lang.String) When I view the client progress # fit.ClientInteractionSteps.iViewTheClientProgress() Progress for Hiba: Completed 3 out of 5 sessions this week. Then I should see the progress details for "Hiba" # fit.ClientInteractionSteps.iShouldSeeTheProgressDetailsFor(java.lang.String)

testcase.name: Successful login with valid details
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Successful login with valid details # src/feature/sign.feature:3 Given the user is on the login page # fit.SiginSteps.the_user_is_on_the_login_page() When the user enters valid username and password "Wafaa"+"N002" # fit.SiginSteps.the_user_enters_valid_username_and_password(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) And the user clicks the login button # fit.SiginSteps.the_user_clicks_the_login_button() Then the user should be redirected to the dashboard # fit.SiginSteps.the_user_should_be_redirected_to_the_dashboard()

testcase.name: Unsuccessful login with invalid details
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Unsuccessful login with invalid details # src/feature/sign.feature:10 Given the user is on the login page # fit.SiginSteps.the_user_is_on_the_login_page() When the user enters an invalid username or password "Rasmiya"+"0000" # fit.SiginSteps.the_user_enters_invalid_username_or_password(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) And the user clicks the login button # fit.SiginSteps.the_user_clicks_the_login_button() Then the user should see an error message indicating incorrect credentials # fit.SiginSteps.the_user_should_see_an_error_message_indicating_incorrect_credentials()

testcase.name: Unsuccessful login with missing details
testcase.system-out: Scenario: Unsuccessful login with missing details # src/feature/sign.feature:16 Given the user is on the login page # fit.SiginSteps.the_user_is_on_the_login_page() When the user leaves the username or password field empty # fit.SiginSteps.the_user_leaves_the_username_or_password_field_empty() And the user clicks the login button # fit.SiginSteps.the_user_clicks_the_login_button() Then the user should see an error message indicating that all fields are required # fit.SiginSteps.the_user_should_see_an_error_message_indicating_that_all_fields_are_required()
